title: How to Cook Corned Beef and Cabbage

steps.headline: Invest in a flat brisket at your supermarket or butcher's shop.
Defrost the meat in the refrigerator for 24 hours, if it is frozen.
steps.description: For ease of cooking, you may simply want to buy a fresh brisket.

steps.headline: Remove from the refrigerator.
steps.description: Slice off large chunks of fat on the surface of the meat. Unless you are making pastrami with part of it, this will just turn to gelatin after cooking for several hours.

steps.headline: Decide how long you want your brining to take.
steps.description: Some chefs brine for 48 hours and others do it for 7 to 10 days before. If you are cooking corned beef for the first time, you may want to start brining for less time and increase in the future.

steps.headline: Place a large saucepan on the stove.
steps.description:
Add the following:
2 qts. (1.9l) of water, 1 cup of kosher salt and 4 tbsp. (20g) of pink curing salt #1. This is what gives corned beef its pink color. Using other salt will leave the flesh gray. Pour in 1/2 cup (94.5g) of brown sugar, 2 bay leaves and 2 crushed cloves of garlic. Mix in your pickling spices. You can use the recipe of your choice, but a good mix is 1 tbsp. (6.9g) of whole peppercorns, 1.5 inches of cinnamon sticks, 1 tbsp. (6.3g) of dill seeds, 1/2 tbsp. (2.7g) of hot red pepper flakes, 1/2 tbsp. (3g) of mustard seeds, 1/2 tbsp. (2.7g) of coriander seeds, 1/2 tbsp. (3g) of celery seeds, 1/2 tbsp. (2.7g) of ground ginger and 1/1 tbsp. (2.1g) of dried thyme leaves, 1 tbsp. (5g) of whole allspice berries and 1/2 tsp. (3g) of whole cloves.

steps.headline: Heat on high until the salts and sugar have dissolved.
Remove the pan from heat.
steps.description: Fill it with ice to cool it before brining the meat.

steps.headline: Place the beef brisket in a very large sealable plastic bag.
Pour in the brine.
steps.description: Try to remove excess air. Seal it well.

steps.headline: Place it in the refrigerator for 48 hours to 7 days.
Remove the meat from the refrigerator.
steps.description: Allow it to come to room temperature.

steps.headline: Rinse the brisket off with cold water.
Place a very large stock pot on the stove.
Cover the corned beef with water by an inch (2.5cm).
Bring the water to a low boil.
Remove the beef from the water.
steps.description: Pour the salty water out. Repeat the process of placing the beef inside the stock pot and covering it with water. This step is only necessary when you have brined the beef for a very long time. It reduces the saltiness of the corned beef, making it more palatable.

steps.headline: Bring the water to a boil.
Turn the heat down to low.
steps.description: Cover the pot with a lid.

steps.headline: Allow the beef to simmer for 2.5 hours.
steps.description: If a lot of steam is escaping, you may need to add warm water during the cooking process. The brisket should remain submerged the entire time.

steps.headline: Chop up large carrots into 1.5 to 2 inch sections.
steps.description: Chop a head of cabbage coarsely. Slice 2 onions.

steps.headline: Peel 18 small potatoes.
Add the vegetables to the pot.
Test the beef, potatoes and carrots.
steps.description: Each should be fork tender when they are ready to serve.

steps.headline: Remove and drain the vegetables.
steps.description: Remove the brisket and slice it against the grain. Serve your corned beef and cabbage immediately.

steps.headline: Finished.

text:
Buy Brisket Invest in a flat brisket at your supermarket or butcher's shop.  Defrost the meat in the refrigerator for 24 hours, if it is frozen. For ease of cooking, you may simply want to buy a fresh brisket. Remove from the refrigerator. Slice off large chunks of fat on the surface of the meat. Unless you are making pastrami with part of it, this will just turn to gelatin after cooking for several hours. Make Brine Decide how long you want your brining to take. Some chefs brine for 48 hours and others do it for 7 to 10 days before. If you are cooking corned beef for the first time, you may want to start brining for less time and increase in the future. Place a large saucepan on the stove. Add the following:
2 qts. (1.9l) of water, 1 cup of kosher salt and 4 tbsp. (20g) of pink curing salt #1. This is what gives corned beef its pink color. Using other salt will leave the flesh gray. Pour in 1/2 cup (94.5g) of brown sugar, 2 bay leaves and 2 crushed cloves of garlic. Mix in your pickling spices. You can use the recipe of your choice, but a good mix is 1 tbsp. (6.9g) of whole peppercorns, 1.5 inches of cinnamon sticks, 1 tbsp. (6.3g) of dill seeds, 1/2 tbsp. (2.7g) of hot red pepper flakes, 1/2 tbsp. (3g) of mustard seeds, 1/2 tbsp. (2.7g) of coriander seeds, 1/2 tbsp. (3g) of celery seeds, 1/2 tbsp. (2.7g) of ground ginger and 1/1 tbsp. (2.1g) of dried thyme leaves, 1 tbsp. (5g) of whole allspice berries and 1/2 tsp. (3g) of whole cloves. Heat on high until the salts and sugar have dissolved.  Remove the pan from heat. Fill it with ice to cool it before brining the meat. Corned Beef Brine Place the beef brisket in a very large sealable plastic bag.  Pour in the brine. Try to remove excess air. Seal it well. Place it in the refrigerator for 48 hours to 7 days.  Cook Corned Beef Remove the meat from the refrigerator. Allow it to come to room temperature. Rinse the brisket off with cold water.  Place a very large stock pot on the stove. Put the brined beef inside. Cover the corned beef with water by an inch (2.5cm).  Bring the water to a low boil.  Remove the beef from the water. Pour the salty water out. Repeat the process of placing the beef inside the stock pot and covering it with water. This step is only necessary when you have brined the beef for a very long time. It reduces the saltiness of the corned beef, making it more palatable. Bring the water to a boil.  Turn the heat down to low. Cover the pot with a lid. Allow the beef to simmer for 2.5 hours. If a lot of steam is escaping, you may need to add warm water during the cooking process. The brisket should remain submerged the entire time. Add Vegetables Chop up large carrots into 1.5 to 2 inch sections. Chop a head of cabbage coarsely. Slice 2 onions. Peel 18 small potatoes.  Add the vegetables to the pot. Simmer for 30 minutes. Test the beef, potatoes and carrots. Each should be fork tender when they are ready to serve. Remove and drain the vegetables. Remove the brisket and slice it against the grain. Serve your corned beef and cabbage immediately. Finished.
